application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: 1 x Apple (applicants ref. T2) - A small apple situated close to the front right hand corner of the house should be thinned by some 15% and reshaped as necessary.1 x Cherry (applicants ref. T3) - Fell above close to ground level by sectional lopping and roping down as necessary.  Subject to access, machine grind main root balls(s) of stumps to 150mm below existing ground level, leaving chippings in situ.1 x Cherry (applicants ref. T4) - Fell above close to ground level by sectional lopping and roping down as necessary.  Subject to access, machine grind main root balls(s) of stumps to 150mm below existing ground level, leaving chippings in situ.1 x  Apple (applicants ref. T5) - Our client would like to try and maintain this by crown thinning (20%), lifting lower branches and deadwooding in the first case, but is seeking permission to fell if the tree fails within the next 6 months.Fell above close to ground level by sectional lopping and roping down as necessary.  Subject to access, machine grind main root balls(s) of stumps to 150mm below existing ground level, leaving chippings in situ.1 x Contorted Willow (applicants ref. T6) - A twisted willow tree situated in the bottom right hand corner of the garden should be reduced and reshaped as necessary in order to form a more compact specimen - Reduce by 1.5m. Remove limb on shed. Remove deadwood. Shape remainder.
